Subjects: lovers, addresses to beloved; women, as speakers/narrators
_description: Poem to a deceiving lover — one 8-line stanza

BLAdd5465.First Lines:
Yowre counturfetyng with doubyll delyngAvaylyth nothyng and wote ye
                    why…
BLAdd5465.Last Lines:
…When that ye do lye then speke ye so swetelyAnd thynk the
                    contrary thus knowe we well
BLAdd5465.Note:
With music in three voices (of which the lowest is ‘ad
                        placitum’) credited to William Newarke.
